revised_title: An Account of a Volcanic Hill Near Inverness: Thomas West's Observations
tldr: Thomas West, in his letter to Mr. Lane, describes a volcanic hill near Inverness, Scotland, which he calls Creck Faterick or Peter's Rock. He provides specimens of lava and discusses the hill's features, such as its steep, craggy terrain and a small plane surrounded by rocks. West also mentions the lack of attention paid to this phenomenon and the possibility of more volcanic activity in the area.
